page.title: 05CHANGES IN DORNIE VILLAGE.
page.content: The main changes in the area have been the reduction in the number of houses. There were many more after the first war.There were more women than men after the first war. This meant more cooperation between people than there is now particularly in such activities as peat cutting. There were many more shops than now.There were boatbuilders a china shop,a tailor shop,two smithies,a bank and a butcher shop. The houses were very poor with no sanitation or power.There were few tourists.Now there are very few services.The village is untidy with lots of garbage.It used to be tidy and no one put litter on the shore.There were of course no tin cans or plastic bottles which now litter the place.
